summary: This is an email dated September 17, 2020, providing updates on legal proceedings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses the Maxwell defense team's ex parte application to delay production of victim photographs not part of the indictment and Judge Alison J. Nathan's subsequent orders and rulings on the matter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of the legal case; her defense team is making applications in the proceedings.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case; ordered the government to show cause regarding an ex parte submission and later rejected the defense's request to proceed ex parte.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Judge Nathan Rejects Ex Parte Application
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan rejected the Maxwell defense team's request to proceed ex parte on an application to delay production of victim photographs, but allowed them to withdraw and refile on notice.

events.title: Government Response to Show Cause Order
events.description: The government submitted a letter showing cause why the Maxwell defense's Rule 16(d) application should be ex parte and under seal, as ordered by Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submitted an ex parte application under Rule 16(d) seeking to delay production of photographs of victims not named in the indictment.
Judge Alison J. Nathan ordered the government to show cause why the defense submission should be ex parte and under seal.
Judge Nathan ultimately rejected the defense's request to proceed ex parte but permitted them to withdraw the application and file a new one on notice.
